basics.name: Zhongtao (Tony) Guan
basics.label: Undergraduate Researcher
basics.summary: Undergraduate student at ShanghaiTech University and MIT with strong research and project experience in robotics and power systems.

work.name: Massachusetts Institute of Technology
work.summary: Conducting research on insect-scale robots and hybrid locomotion.
highlights: Developed a sub-gram flapping-wing passive hopper for insect-scale robots.
Conducted trajectory optimization and online NLMPC for complex tasks.

work.name: ShanghaiTech University
work.summary: Conducted research on fault location for power systems and designed inverters for photovoltaic systems.
highlights: Proposed methods for fault location on hybrid power systems.
Designed and controlled a three-phase inverter for grid-connected photovoltaic systems.

awards.title: Outstanding Teaching Assistant
awards.summary: Acted as head TA for Electric Circuit course, coordinating TAs and assisting with lectures and grading.

awards.title: RoboMaster University Championship
awards.summary: Won 2nd Prize in the Shanghai division and 3rd Prize nationally.

awards.title: National Undergraduate Electronic Design Contest
awards.summary: Won 2nd Prize in the Shanghai division.

publications.name: Preliminary Result of Cury: A Backdrivable Leg Design using Linear Actuators
publications.publisher: IEEE/RSJ International Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems (IROS)
publications.summary: Presented a backdrivable leg design with linear actuators for walking and jumping.

publications.name: Accurate Single-Ended Fault Location for Cable-OHL Hybrid Transmission Lines
publications.publisher: Power and Energy Society General Meeting (PESGM)
publications.summary: Proposed methods for fault location on hybrid transmission lines.

references.name: Kevin Chen
references.reference: Research Supervisor at MIT, EECS Department
